posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
This character is based on a Faerun myth of the northern barbarian tribes. They worshipped Uthgard and they divided amongst different tribes, each with one beast totem that influenced their combat philosophy. I choose the Bear warriors for their unparalleled migth & fortitude and made a barbarian build out of this that rivals some Dwarven defenders in terms of endurance but without those alignment restrictions they have, because berserkers are free spirits.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Notes in passing:

-20% XP penalty from Level 22 to end.

Yielding 4 points from Search (and/or Locks, if preferred), the toon will still be able to detect deadly traps (albeit with slightly slower scouting), be able to recover all deadly traps except gas and be able to cast all level spells from scrolls without failure.  Targets (modified ranks): DTrap 21, UMD 33, Search 16 (detect on d20 rolls 6-20). Get in the habit of using Fox pots during scouting to maximize detection.

There will be more combat effectiveness advancing Prowess and AS up to just after EDR 3 probably wedged in between the 2 WS.  Neither AB nor AC is dominant without taunting (which seems to be an intentional omission in this build, probably due to low intrinsic CHA level and commitment to trap skills) so strike while the iron is hot.

It's also probably a worthwhile alternative to swap the pre-epic level positions of BF and IC with the chosen weapon's poor crit range but dominant damage multiplier.

Otherwise, seems a well-planned concept that delivers an early TR at Lvl 24.  A shame candidates considering this build for their own trial will need to duplicate the skill allotment that's been obviously hashed out already.

Oh, and the alignment restriction is NG-TN-NE-CG-CN-CE.  CN seems to be a thematic decision (TN is equally effective vs smites).
